mainEntity.name: Do general contractors need an OSHA compliance kit?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, general contractors are required to maintain OSHA documentation, provide safety training, and display required posters — kits simplify all of this.

mainEntity.name: What should be included in an OSHA compliance kit for construction?

acceptedAnswer.text: Key items include injury logs, training records, hazard communication programs, safety posters, and documentation templates for toolbox talks.

mainEntity.name: Are these OSHA kits updated to current regulations?

acceptedAnswer.text: Reputable kits are updated annually to reflect changes in OSHA standards and construction-specific compliance needs.
